meanings.definition: To apply pressure to someone or something in order to persuade or force them to do something.
meanings.sent1: She kept pressurising her friend to join the dance class.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson was pressurising the customer to buy the expensive product.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully kept pressurising the students to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The constant pressurising from his boss made him feel suffocated.
meanings.sent5: The relentless pressurising from the media made the celebrity break down.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel stressed or anxious by putting pressure on them.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam was pressurising the students to study harder.
meanings.sent2: The tight deadline was pressurising the team to complete the project quickly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was pressurising the dog by sitting on its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The constant pressurising at work was like a weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The looming deadline was pressurising him to finish the report before the end of the day.

meanings.definition: To maintain a high pressure within a closed system.
meanings.sent1: The engineer was pressurising the container to test its durability.
meanings.sent2: The scuba diver was pressurising his suit before going underwater.
meanings.sent3: The chef was pressurising the cooker to speed up the cooking process.
meanings.sent4: The athlete felt like he was pressurising his body to perform at its best.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was pressurising the tire to the recommended level before the long journey.
